Everit - LQMG Maven Plugin
Last Published: 2014-02-19  | Version: 1.0.0
Overview
  • Introduction
  • Goals
Project Documentation
  • Project Information

generate:generate

Full name:

org.everit.osgi.dev:lqmg-maven-plugin:1.0.0:generate

Description:

Generates QueryDSL Metadata classes from Liquibase schema files.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.
  • Requires dependency resolution of artifacts in scope: compile+runtime.
  • Binds by default to the lifecycle phase: generate-sources.

Required Parameters

Name Type Since Description
schemaExpression String - The expression of the schema that should be the starting point of the generation. Expressions references to the name of a "liquibase.schema" capability of a bundle. E.g. If the bundle has "Provide-Capability: liquibase.schema;name=mySchema", the value of this property should be simply "myApp". It is possible to append filter to the expression. E.g.: mySchema;filter:=("someAttribute=someValue").
User property is: lqmg.schemaExpression.
targetFolder String - The folder where source will be generated to.
Default value is: src/main/generated/java.
User property is: lqmg.targetFolder.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
packageName String - The java package of the generated QueryDSL metamodel classes. Default-value: empty, that means that the package will be either empty or derived from the schema.
User property is: lqmg.packageName.
schemaPattern String - Metadata classes will be generated only from that schema that matches exactly with the value of this property. In case it is not defined, all schema will used.
User property is: lqmg.schemaPattern.
schemaToPackage boolean - A flag indicating if the package name of the Liquibase Metadata classes should contain the name of the database schema.
Default value is: true.
User property is: lqmg.schemaToPackage.

Parameter Details

packageName:

The java package of the generated QueryDSL metamodel classes. Default-value: empty, that means that the package will be either empty or derived from the schema.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: lqmg.packageName

schemaExpression:

The expression of the schema that should be the starting point of the generation. Expressions references to the name of a "liquibase.schema" capability of a bundle. E.g. If the bundle has "Provide-Capability: liquibase.schema;name=mySchema", the value of this property should be simply "myApp". It is possible to append filter to the expression. E.g.: mySchema;filter:=("someAttribute=someValue").
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • User Property: lqmg.schemaExpression

schemaPattern:

Metadata classes will be generated only from that schema that matches exactly with the value of this property. In case it is not defined, all schema will used.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: lqmg.schemaPattern

schemaToPackage:

A flag indicating if the package name of the Liquibase Metadata classes should contain the name of the database schema.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: lqmg.schemaToPackage
  • Default: true

targetFolder:

The folder where source will be generated to.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • User Property: lqmg.targetFolder
  • Default: src/main/generated/java
